title: New Mexico Livestock and Animal Mutilations

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Livestock and Animal Mutilations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request any and all files in connection with animal or livestock mutilations from 1967 through 2022. I believe these records are under the purview of the New Mexico Livestock Board.

As a citizen of the United States, I am entitled to access public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I request that you provide me with copies of all records, documents, notes, reports, and any other material related to animal or livestock mutilations that have been investigated by the New Mexico Livestock Board from January 1, 1967, to December 31, 2022.

Please provide me with any available information regarding the following:

The number of reported animal or livestock mutilations in New Mexico from 1967 to 2022.
The locations of the reported animal or livestock mutilations.
The number of investigations launched into these incidents.
The results of the investigations, including any reports, conclusions, or findings.
If there are any fees associated with fulfilling this request, please inform me in advance. I would appreciate a response to this request within 20 business days, as required by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Records Request Received - Request ID: 3869
communications.communication:
Dear Nathan Isaac,

Please find a link below with records responsive to your request.

Request 3869 5-11-2023<https://www.nmlbonline.com/maildoc.php?id=103710&guid=DBEF12CE-725A-17F8-BCDD-00133B21A438>

The bodycam footage for the report exceeds 2 GBs. Please advise if you wish to receive these large files by one of the following methods:


  *   We can prepare multiple CDs and deliver in one package by USPS mail or pickup at the front desk for a $5 fee.
  *   We can prepare a USB external drive and deliver by USPS mail or pickup at the front desk for a $10 fee.
  *   You can arrange for a time to bring your own new/unopened USB external drive and we will copy all of the data to that at no charge.

We do anticipate more bodycam video that may be responsive to your request. With that in mind we can wait until the entirety of the bodycam video is collected and then provide it in one lump sum. Please indicate if you would like us to do that or if you would prefer the video be made available as it is processed.

We require more time to search for any additional responsive records, until May 18, 2023.

title: NIL records

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-The records previously released to the Athens Banner-Herald pursuant to a ruling and subsequent agreement made between that newspaper and the University of Georgia Athletic Association in Clarke County Superior Court, case SU21CV0558.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Landon Edwards

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Georgia Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 15, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records (23-139)
communications.communication:
Mr. Edwards—



This is to acknowledge receipt of your March 15, 2023, request for documents under the Georgia Open Records Act, and is in accordance with the three-day period of response pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(b)(2).



You have requested “The records previously released to the Athens Banner-Herald pursuant to a ruling and subsequent agreement made between that newspaper and the University of Georgia Athletic Association in Clarke County Superior Court, case SU21CV0558.”



Because you have requested records of the University’s intercollegiate sports program, I have forwarded it to the University’s Athletic Department for an assessment of the scope of potentially responsive documents, estimation of the costs to search for and produce responsive records, and consideration of potentially applicable exemptions.



A written response to your request will arrive within the time-period specified in O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(d.1).



Regards,


Bob Taylor
Division of Marketing & Communications
Open Records Manager
Hodgson Oil Building, Suite 200 N | 286 Oconee St. | Athens, GA 30602
706-542-8090 | btaylor@uga.edu<mailto:btaylor@uga.edu> | www.uga.edu<http://www.uga.edu/>
[University of Georgia]
[Facebook]<https://www.facebook.com/uga.edu> [Twitter] <https://twitter.com/universityofga>  [Instagram] <https://www.instagram.com/universityofga/>  [Linkedin] <https://www.linkedin.com/edu/school?id=18190>  [Youtube] <https://www.youtube.com/uga>  [Snapchat] <https://www.snapchat.com/add/university-ga>

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #23-139
communications.communication:
Mr. Taylor,

I respectfully challenge the determination you have made in processing my request. While I am requesting records that originated with the University's intercollegiate sports program, I am of the belief that such records are in the custody of the Open Records Manager. 

Upon information and belief, your office retains records of public records requests received and *your office's responses to each request, including any records disclosed to the requestor*, for 3 years, in compliance with the University System of Georgia's record retention policy. 

The Athens Banner-Herald previously requested certain University of Georgia Athletic Association (UGAA) records on August 2, 2021 (#21-371). On November 2, 2021, you denied this request. In October 2022, the Athens Banner-Herald made a "Renewed Open Records Request" directly to the UGAA. This request was fulfilled in March 2023 pursuant to court order. 

It is unclear if your office is responsible for retaining records relating to the ABH's October 2022 request. If your office does currently hold these records, you have incorrectly claimed that my request falls under the scope of O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(d.1), and I would ask that you process my request under the standard parameters of the Georgia Open Records Act. 

I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Landon Edwards

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #23-139
communications.communication:

With respect to your request, please find the attached responsive files.



Regards,


Bob Taylor
Division of Marketing & Communications

title: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all electronic communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, sent or received by the following individuals for the period of time between July 1, 2022 and May 16, 2023:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

Please provide me with copies of all such communications in electronic format, preferably in a searchable PDF or text file. 

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

I am requesting these records in order to conduct research on a matter of public interest. I believe that these records will be helpful in understanding the activities of these individuals and their impact on the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PAC Bellevue

communications.subject: New Request for Records / PRR 05162023-Anon
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

We have received your May 17, 2023 request for public records and have assigned it tracking number PRR 05162023-Anon.

I understand your request to be:


I request all electronic communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, sent or received by the following individuals for the period of time between July 1, 2022 and May 16, 2023:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

Please provide me with copies of all such communications in electronic format, preferably in a searchable PDF or text file.

A clarification question: Are you requesting communications sent/received only between these five staff members, between a subset of the five or all communications sent/received by these employees to/from any source?

The latter search will take considerably longer than the former because – for email communications alone – these staff members appear in tens of thousands of messages annually. For example, during the identified time period, Eva Collins appears in the “to” and/or “from” fields of 23,943 emails. We will need to review each email to check for protected information (such as student identifiers or privileged legal communications). The same will apply to the other forms of electronic communications.

I want to get you what you’re looking for as quickly and efficiently as possible. Perhaps we could break this request into pieces and work on one piece at a time? If you like, we could search first for communications sent/received between these five employees and produce those records to you. We can then move through the remainder of the request in whatever order you prefer. Please let me know if this approach would be acceptable to you.

I have begun identifying potentially responsive email records. Once we hear back from you about the desired scope of your request and your preferred method for organizing our search, I will provide you with an anticipated date for our first production of records.
Best regards,

Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
As for your suggestion to break down this request, we find this acceptable.

To provide further clarification, the first part of the request is for any electronic communication between these individuals that includes at least one of the mentioned individuals in either the "to", "cc", or "from" fields.

Once this part of the request is fulfilled, we would like to receive all communications as initially requested for these individuals. We would like these records to be provided in reverse chronological order, beginning with the most recent. In terms of priority, we would prefer to receive the records for each individual separately, following this order:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

We believe this will ensure we receive the required information in a prompt manner. We look forward to your timely response and appreciate your assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

Thank you very much for your response and clarifications. In keeping with your directions, I’ve run the following email archive search:


  *   All emails sent on or after July 1, 2022 & on or before May 16, 2023
  *   Where the “to”, “cc”, or “from” fields contain any of the following email addresses:

JarvisA@bsd405.org
DevitaM@bsd405.org
AramakiK@bsd405.org
CollinsE@bsd405.org
McminimeeS@bsd405.org

This search returns 349,698 messages:
[cid:image001.png@01D99465.4588EEF0]

I’m happy to pull those messages and begin the review process but it will take a very long time to complete this production.

With the understanding that, at your direction, we will begin review on the 349,698-message production, would you be willing to start with the following search:


  *   All emails sent on or after July 1, 2022 & on or before May 16, 2023
  *   Where the “to”, “cc”, or “from” fields contain any all of the following email addresses:

JarvisA@bsd405.org<mailto:JarvisA@bsd405.org>
DevitaM@bsd405.org<mailto:DevitaM@bsd405.org>
AramakiK@bsd405.org<mailto:AramakiK@bsd405.org>
CollinsE@bsd405.org<mailto:CollinsE@bsd405.org>
McminimeeS@bsd405.org<mailto:McminimeeS@bsd405.org>

This search returns 1,006 messages:
[cid:image002.png@01D99468.02553AF0]

While it will still take some time to review and prep each email for the above search, having a much smaller starting batch will help us get you a complete production as quickly as possible.

Apologies for the lengthy email – I just want you to have all the information so you can make the decision about where we start. As noted above, you can at any point let me know when/if you want to change the direction of our productions. I will begin working on the 1,006-message search now in order to get things moving. Please let me know if this is an acceptable starting-point or if you’d prefer another search for our initial production. If the 1,006-message batch is our agreed starting place, I anticipate that we will have a first installment of records ready on or before July 14, 2023. If records are available sooner, I will provide them to you.
Best,
Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for the detailed update - it's much appreciated. I wanted to clarify that we are looking for electronic communications that include any one (or more) of the five named individuals in the "to", "cc", or "from" fields, not necessarily all five at once. We get that this makes for a lot of messages, but it's what we need for our inquiry. Let's stick with the plan of tackling this in chunks and going in reverse chronological order. This seems like the most practical approach given the volume of records.

One more thing: will the search include other forms of electronic communication apart from emails? For instance, we would be interested in instant messages from Microsoft Teams if they're available.

Looking forward to your response and hearing about the next steps. Thanks again for your work on this.

Best,
PAC Bellevue

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
It seems there might be a small misunderstanding in how we are defining the scope of the request. We initially intended our request to be focused as follows:

We are looking for electronic communications where at least one of the named individuals is in the "from" field, and at least one of them is also in either the "to" or "cc" fields. Our original revision was meant to capture this — we don't need every single message where these individuals are present, but those messages where they are directly communicating with each other. This approach should narrow down the search considerably compared to any communication where these individuals are merely included.

Additionally, could you confirm if other forms of electronic communication like instant messages, specifically from Microsoft Teams, will be included in this search?

Thanks for bearing with us and helping clarify these details.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)

PRR 05162023-Anon

I will respond fully tomorrow to make sure I have a clear understanding of your request. Thanks for your patience!
Best,
Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer

Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101

PRR 05162023-Anon

Thank you very much for the additional clarification – that’s very helpful. Let’s see if I’ve got it:


Emails, texts, TEAMs chats sent/received 7/1/22 – 5/16/23 where at least one of the individuals named below is in the "from" field, and at least one of them is also in either the "to" or "cc" fields:



Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee



To be provided in reverse chronological order, beginning with the most recent.



Is that the correct starting point for our search? Thanks for your patience while we get this thing pinned down.
Best,

Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication: Yes, that's spot on! We appreciate all the effort you are putting into getting this sorted out for us. Please go ahead and proceed with the search based on the clarified instructions. Looking forward to seeing the results. Thanks again for all your help!

communications.subject: 1st Installment / PRR 05162023-Anon
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

Using the link below, please find our first production installment of records responsive to your May 16, 2023 request. This production contains 122 email messages (503 pages) sent from Superintendent Jarvis to Melissa Devita from January 1, 2023 to May 16, 2023:

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/e7vuam8pmx6g689nr88vy/Jarvis-to-Devita-1.1.23_5.16.23-122-msgs-_Redacted.pdf?rlkey=168h1tpyisuwhvdfdtze9oy5o&dl=0
(Please let me know if you have any trouble accessing the records in this format.)

No records have been withheld or exempted from this production. In keeping with our obligations under the Public Records Act, which exempts information identifying students and/or parents [RCW 42.56.230(1) & 42.56.070(1)], we have redacted student/parent names, email addresses and phone numbers from these records. As communications between attorneys and clients are also exempt from production [RCW 42.56.070(1) & RCW 5.60.060(2)(a)], some portions of emails containing those communications have been redacted. Every redaction has been marked with a code corresponding to the attached redaction information sheet. The sheet provides additional information about the basis for each redaction.

I continue to work on responsive emails sent during the period of January 1, 2023 to May 16, 2023 and anticipate that our next installment of records will be ready on or before September 1, 2023. If records are available sooner, I will provide them to you. Please let me know if you have any questions or if, at any point, you would like me to shift the focus of my productions – always happy to do so.
Best,
Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

title: Steve Horn Open Records Act Request - 6/18/23

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Steve Horn Open Records Act Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all communications and materials related to the drafting, dissemination, and public release of the May 15, 2023 letter signed by the Attorney General and a group of other Attorneys General pertaining to both the Net-Zero Asset Owner Alliance (also known as "NZAOA" and please search both iterations) and the Net-Zero Insurance Alliance (also known as "NZIA" and please search both iterations). 

Please also send any PDF files created pertaining to this request in their original format. 

For reference, the letter cited can be seen here:

https://attorneygeneral.utah.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-15-NZIA-Letter.pdf

2.) Any and all communications and other materials pertaining to the Net-Zero Insurance Alliance (also known as "NZIA" and please search both iterations) dating between Nov. 1, 2022 through the date of the fulfillment of this request.
Definitions

“Any” and “all” mean all, each, any, and every. “Address” and “mention” mean relates to, refers to, contains, describes, embodies, mentions, constitutes, constituting, supports, corroborates, demonstrates, proves, evidences, shows and/or concerns.

“Document(s)” means any and all written, typed, printed, recorded or graphic matter, however produced, reproduced or stored, whether an original or a copy, and whether prepared, published or released by any person or entity, including but not limited to letters, reports, agreements, correspondence, intra-office or inter-office correspondence, telegrams, minutes or records of meetings, reports or summaries, expressions or statements, lists, drafts and revisions, invoices, receipts, original and preliminary notes, sketches, records, ledgers, contracts, bills of lading, bills, inventories, financial data, maps, memoranda, accounting and financial records, diaries, journals, calendars, statements, work papers, videotapes, photographs, pamphlets, brochures, advertisements, trade letters, press releases, drawings, recaps, tables, articles, summaries of conversations, computer cards, tapes, diskettes, or other means of electronically or magnetically maintaining information, and printouts.

The term “document(s)” also includes electronically stored data from which information can be obtained either directly or by translation through detection devices or readers; any such document is to be produced in a reasonably legible and usable form. The term “document(s)” includes all drafts of a document and all copies that differ in any respect from the original, including any notation, underlining, marking, or information not on the original. The term also includes information stored in, or accessible through, computer or other information retrieval systems (including any computer archives or back-up systems), together with instructions and all other materials necessary to use or interpret such data compilations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steve Horn

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Steve Horn Open Records Act Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Georgia Department of Law, Office of the Attorney General.  We are responding to the Open Records Request below received in our office on June  19th.

Today, June 23rd,  is the third business day following your request. Monday, June 19th was a state holiday.


We have queried our system in search of records responsive to this request and have located potentially responsive documents. Fees associated with this request are based on the time it takes to complete the request which includes, but is not limited to, the initial scan of the universe of documents, eliminating unrelated documents, excluding information exempt by the Open Records Act, and combining documents into an electronic format suitable for delivery.


The fee calculation is based on the time and experience level of the administrative staff and attorneys doing the work. We will always opt for the lowest experience level required to adequately perform the work when fulfilling requests. We estimate it will cost $106.12 to fulfill this request.  Please be advised that this is an estimate, and as such, it may fall outside the range of costs.

We will wait to hear back from you, confirming if the fee and terms are acceptable and that you would like to proceed before we continue your request.

We expect to provide the requested records three weeks from the acceptance of the terms.  Delivery will be by the Department’s secure file-sharing system called Kiteworks, using your email of record.


All the best,

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Steve Horn Open Records Act Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
Dear Records Officer:

I agree to this, yes. Thanks for your response and please let me know best to remit payment when the time comes to do so.

Thank you and have a great rest of your weekend.

Best,
Steve

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Steve Horn Open Records Act Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
We have completed the Open Records Request below.  We compiled the documents into a single PDF file. We are sharing them with you via our secure file-sharing system called Kiteworks. You should have received an email with instructions for accessing the file.

When we identified an email chain, we printed the most recent exchange containing previous emails rather than providing redundant copies of the same email and attachment(s).
Not included in the file are documents that are exempt from release under the confidential attorney work-product privilege pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(42).

We also omitted records containing information that would disclose an electronic signature according to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72 (a)(42).

Pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(c)(1), cost associated with this request totaled $30.45, which is based on 1 hour of administrative time at $20 per hour; 10 minutes of attorney management time at $61.50 per hour.

Please mail a check or money order in the amount of $30.45 payable to the Georgia Department of Law with Matter # 1206114 referenced.

Georgia Department of Law
40 Capitol Square SW
Atlanta, Georgia 30334
Attn: Jotonna Tulloch, Open Records



Best,

title: Police Book Reports (School District Of Palm Beach County)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Police Book Reports (School District Of Palm Beach County)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For any records held or generated by your district's police department, office (or department) of safety and security, special investigative unit, or other law enforcement officials:

1. Any police report, complaint (including by parents, students, or any third party), or investigative records concerning the content of any books, materials, or events at a library.

2. Any photographs, videos, or other evidence/documents referenced in the report, complaint, or investigative records.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: SEPTA Public Announcement Audio Recordings

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: SEPTA Public Announcement Audio Recordings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all audio recordings made for automated public announcement in SEPTA stations and on board any SEPTA vehicle including subway cars, trains, busses, and trolleys. This should include, but should not be limited to, route welcome announcements ("Welcome to Route 34...", etc), announcements for stops on a route, public safety announcements, next-to-arrive announcements, and door closing announcements.

If it exists, the search should include any chimes, bells, or other alerting noise that accompany these announcements.

If possible, the search should include recordings made for this purpose which are not actively used in SEPTA stations or on board SEPTA vehicles.

Recordings made for temporary use and intended for a limited time, for example announcements of temporary detours or schedule modifications, should be excluded from this search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sharp Hall

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: SEPTA Public Announcement Audio Recordings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing to appeal a Right-to-Know request sent to the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority that is “Deemed Denied.” On June 15th, 2023, I sent a request for “Any and all audio recordings made for automated public announcement in SEPTA stations and on board any SEPTA vehicle including subway cars, trains, busses, and trolleys. This should include, but should not be limited to, route welcome announcements ("Welcome to Route 34...", etc), announcements for stops on a route, public safety announcements, next-to-arrive announcements, and door closing announcements.” As of this date I have not received a response.

I assert that these are public records as they represent the activity of the agency. Notably, the PA Right-to-Know Law’s definition of “Record” includes sound recordings. These records are not exempt – the public already hears most of them on a daily basis.

The RTK request, submitted on June 15th, is attached alongside this appeal. The agency did not respond to my request, so it is “deemed denied” and I have no written denial to attach or respond to.

Thank you in advance for your attention to this appeal,

Sharp Hall

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (July 2023) (Stevens County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Scotia-glenville Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Scotia-glenville Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Council on School Health (COSH), including any communications or correspondence between the school district and these organizations, or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

To help identify responsive records, you can limit your time period to 1/1/2017 until the date of final response; also I request that you search for the following terms, which are focused on the American Academy of Pediatrics and its affiliated organizations:

"American Academy of Pediatrics"
"AAP"
"Council on School Health"
"COSH"
"pediatric"
"child health"
"school health"

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence between the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Council on School Health, and the school district or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Re: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Scotia-glenville Central School District)
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

Our IT department has been able to extract all the emails within your scope.  At this time, we have been advised to send the thumb drive (too large a file to send electronically) to our attorneys to comb through and delate or redact any personal/sensitive information.  There will be a charge incurred with this next step.  How would you like us to proceed?

Thank you,
Jill Busman


​Jill Busman
Secretary to the Superintendent
Scotia-Glenville Central School District
900 Preddice Parkway
Scotia, New York 12302
518-347-3600 ext. 71102
jbusman@sgcsd.net

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Scotia-glenville Central School District)
communications.communication:
I appreciate your prompt response and the efforts of the IT department in extracting the emails within the scope of my request. I understand that the next step involves reviewing the emails for any personal or sensitive information that may need to be redacted.

However, I would like to clarify the regulations regarding the costs associated with a FOIL request. According to the New York State Public Officers Law §87(1)(b)(iii), an agency may charge a fee for copies of records, but not for the time spent redacting or reviewing them. This is further supported by the Committee on Open Government, which has consistently advised that an agency may not charge for the time involved in redacting electronic documents.

As such, while I acknowledge that there may be costs associated with copying the records onto a thumb drive, any costs associated with the time spent by your attorneys to review and redact information should not be passed on to the requester.

I also want to confirm, based on your email, that the IT department has successfully copied the records onto a medium that can be provided, which in this case is a thumb drive.

I look forward to your response and the provision of the requested records.

title: "Better Bus" initiative (Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority)

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: "Better Bus" initiative (Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records, including email communications, scientific papers and materials, underlying documentation and data, memos, briefings, etc, about the Market Assessment, which includes how well current bus service meets community needs and what customer trips could best be served by a redesigned transit network and Transit Service Assessment that includes how bus services operate and opportunities for improvement as apart of Phase 1 of the "Better Bus" initiative. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Kauffman

communications.subject: Your PARP/Privacy request has been received
communications.communication:
The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) has received your request for records.
More information on the PARP/Privacy process is available online at: https://www.wmata.com/about/records/.

communications.subject: Better Bus documents request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Our Counsel's office received your PARP request for documents related to Phase 1 of our Better Bus initiative. Due to the broad scope of the inquiry, I wanted to flag that many documents are already available at wmata.com/betterbus<https://wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/index.cfm>, as well as documents presented to the Board of Directors such as this April update<https://www.wmata.com/about/board/meetings/board-pdfs/upload/3A-Better-Bus-Network-Redesign.pdf>. In order get the information you are looking for in a timely manner, I was wondering if you have any specific questions or information I could point you to. If you'd like the PARP office to continue processing this request in full, let me know as well. Thanks,

Ian Jannetta
Media Relations Manager - Metro

communications.subject: PARP Request 23-0142; Better Bus Market & Transit Service Assessments
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Kaufmann,



The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) acknowledges and provides a partial response to your June 20, 2023, Public Access to Records Policy (PARP) request regarding the Better Bus Network Redesign. Specifically, you requested the following records:



"Any and all records, including email communications, scientific papers and materials, underlying documentation and data, memos, briefings, etc, about the Market Assessment, which includes how well current bus service meets community needs and what customer trips could best be served by a redesigned transit network and Transit Service Assessment that includes how bus services operate and opportunities for improvement as apart of Phase 1 of the 'Better Bus' initiative."


Please be advised that WMATA is an interstate compact agency created by the Commonwealth of Virginia, State of Maryland, and the District of Columbia, and not a D.C. agency.  See Pub. L. No. 89-774, 80 Stat. 1324 (1966); Va. Code Ann. § 33.2-3100; Md. Code Ann., Transp. § 10-204; D.C. Code Ann. § 9-1107.1).  Accordingly, WMATA is not subject to the D.C. Freedom of Information Act.  See D.C. Code § 9-1107.1, § 77.  Therefore, your request will be processed pursuant to WMATA's PARP.[1]


Partial Decision



WMATA has located the following public records related to your request available online at:



  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/index.cfm
  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/Resources.cfm
  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/upload/Better-Bus_Phase-1-Engagement-Summary_FINAL.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/upload/Better-Bus_Phase-1-Analysis-Findings_FINAL-1.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/upload/BBNR_MarketAssessment_FINAL_012423.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/initiatives/plans/Better-Bus/upload/BBNR_ExistingConditions_FINAL_011223-1.pdf
  *   http://bustransformationproject.com/resources/
  *   https://www.wmata.com/about/board/meetings/board-pdfs/upload/11A-Better-Bus-Network-Redesign-Finalized.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/about/board/meetings/board-pdfs/upload/3B-Better-Bus-Network-Redesign.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/about/board/meetings/board-pdfs/upload/4A-Better-Bus-Network-Redesign-2.pdf
  *   https://www.wmata.com/about/board/meetings/board-pdfs/upload/3A-Better-Bus-Network-Redesign.pdf

However, please be advised that WMATA is unable to continue processing your request as you have not provided a timeframe. PARP § 7.5 requires requesters to "describe the records that are being requested in sufficient detail to enable WMATA to locate them with a reasonable amount of effort."  Please let us know if the records linked above satisfy your request. If they do not, please clarify what additional records you are seeking, and provide a timeframe for your request. If we do not receive a response by Wednesday, July 26, 2023, your request will be closed.

GENERAL INFORMATION:



Although we are not yet able to provide any responsive records, we can impart the following general information regarding your request:


Time Period for Processing Requests



WMATA generally aims to respond to a request for records within 20 business days following receipt of the request.  WMATA processes requests in the order that requests are received.  Furthermore, additional processing time is required for requests that prove to be complex.



Exemptions

The PARP provides exemptions for certain types of data, including: (1) information that could compromise WMATA infrastructure or security; (2) information that is solely related to the internal personnel rules and practices; (3) information that is exempt by statute; (4) proprietary commercial or financial information; (5) intra-agency and inter-agency memoranda information which would not be made available by law to a party in litigation with WMATA; (6) information that, if released, would cause a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy; (7) certain information compiled for law enforcement purposes; (8) registered SmarTrip® information; and (9) customer financial information.  Generally, WMATA's response will not include any exempt information.

Appeal Rights

If you wish to appeal WMATA's decision, in accordance with PARP § 9.1, you may file a written appeal of the action with the Executive Vice President, External Relations (or designee) at PARP_Appeal@wmata.com<mailto:PARP_Appeal@wmata.com>, within 30 business days of the date of this decision letter.  Further details about our appeals process can be found on our website.


Future correspondence should reference the request number noted in the subject line of this correspondence. If you have any questions, please contact Suraya Sabri at ssabri@wmata.com<mailto:ssabri@wmata.com> or 202-962-2058.  If she is unavailable, please contact Richard Noh at RDNoh@wmata.com<mailto:RDNoh@wmata.com> or 202-962-2569.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Rashbaum



[cid:image001.jpg@01D9B4B1.227A1EE0]

Benjamin Rashbaum
Senior Counsel II
Legal Department
300 7th Street, SW
Washington, DC 20024
P: 202-962-1926
F: 202-962-2550
E: BRashbaum@wmata.com<mailto:BRashbaum@wmata.com>

This transmission is intended only for the proper recipient(s).  It is confidential and may contain attorney-client privileged information or information prepared in anticipation of litigation.  If you are not the proper recipient, please notify the sender immediately and delete this message.  Any unauthorized review, copying, or use of this message is prohibited.



________________________________

[1] The PARP can be found on WMATA's website at https://www.wmata.com/about/records/public-records.cfm, under the section marked "Legal Affairs."

Sincerely,

Hal Flak

title: BCoPD Active Employees List 2022/5/21

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: BCoPD Active Employees List 2022/5/21
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the list of all active employees of the Baltimore County Police Department, as of May 21, 2022 or more recent. The fields I am requesting are:

- Employee ID
- First name
- Last name
- Middle name
- Suffix
- Ethnic group/race
- Sex/gender
- Age or year of birth
- Original hire date
- Rehire Dates, if any
- Promotion Dates, if any
- Job Title
- Unit or assignment
- Supervisor ID
- Annual Salary

For an example of the document I am requesting, you can see my previous MPIA request to the Baltimore County Police Department: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/baltimore-county-322/bcopd-active-employees-list-202061-93986/

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dan Staples, on behalf of Open Justice Baltimore

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agenda, meeting minutes, presentations, handouts, transcript, a list of participants from the June 2, 2021 meeting between the American Society of Health-System Pharmacists (ASHP) and Peter Marks of the FDA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act request # 2023-4208

title: Criminal investigation into library books

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Criminal investigation into library books
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of any complaint, report, or investigation into any books, materials, or events at the Butt-Hollingsworth Public Library. This includes any reports, narratives, communications with others (including witnesses, complainants, suspects, and other government officials), and any photographs, video, audio, or other records developed or obtained in connection with the complaint, report, or investigation.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: FOAA Request from MuckRock Newst: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log (MDACF)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Boucher:

This email is in response to a request seeking information pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act.

The Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (DIFW) acknowledges your request, while simultaneously reserving the right to withhold, in part or in full, documents that are protected from disclosure by rule or statute.  Once we complete our review of the requested material, DIFW will provide you with an estimate of the time necessary to complete the process of responding to the remainder of your request.  We may also require the payment of costs as authorized by law.

DIFW will notify you, within a reasonable time, of a date and time for review and copying of the documents (or by transmitting copies to you) not protected from disclosure.  Should any of the requested documents be withheld, we will identify the reason for not disclosing them.

In response to a portion of your request, all state agency retention schedules are available by visiting the Maine State Archives website at: https://www.maine.gov/sos/arc/records/state/agencyschedules.html

A list of available IFW forms can also be viewed online by visiting our website at:  https://www.maine.gov/ifw/forms/

Best Regards -
Becky Orff
Maine Dept of Inland Fisheries & Wildlife
Commissioner's Office
353 Water St, SHS 41
Augusta ME 04333
Phone: (207) 287-5202
Fax:  (207) 287-6395
mefishwildlife.com<http://www.maine.gov/ifw/> | facebook<http://www.facebook.com/mainefishwildlife> | twitter<http://www.twitter.com/mefishwildlife>

Correspondence to and from this office is considered a public record and may be subject to a request under the Maine Freedom of Access Act. Information that you wish to keep confidential should not be included in email correspondence.

title: Network Breach and Cyber Attack Records (2018-Present)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Network Breach and Cyber Attack Records (2018-Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Jordan Lassiter
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 13, 2023

Yorktown Central School District
2725 Crompond Road
Yorktown Heights, NY 10598

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records Pertaining to Network Breaches or Cyber Attacks

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the New York Freedom of Information Law, Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by Yorktown Central School District pertaining to:

1) Any network breaches or cyber-attacks that have occurred within your organization, including any records of unauthorized access, data theft, or system compromise from January 1, 2018 to the present.

2) Any internal investigations or reviews conducted in response to a suspected or confirmed network breach, including any reports, findings, or recommendations.

3) Any incident response plans or policies in place to address network breaches, including any procedures for mitigating and remediating the effects of such incidents.

4) Any communications between your organization and affected individuals, customers, or partners regarding network breaches or incidents.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with the New York Freedom of Information Law. If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log.

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation.

I also request a waiver of all fees in connection with this request as disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within five business days.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

communications.subject: FOIL REQUEST
communications.communication:
I am writing to advise you that we are processing the FOIL request dated
June 14, 2023.


The Freedom of Information Law requires public bodies to make
reasonably-identified existing documents available for inspection and
copying, but does not require research or narrative responses.
Accordingly, we will not be responding to those inquiries to the extent
that the information is not available to you from existing documents.



It is expected you will receive the response on *or before* July 18, 2023.
We will invoice you in accordance with our purchasing policy for postage
reimbursement and a copy charge of $0.25 per page if your FOIL request
requires copies. For requests taking a minimum of two hours or more to
complete (not including search time or administrative costs), an amount
equal to the hourly salary attributed to the lowest paid employee who has
the ability to prepare a copy of the requested records in the format
requested will be charged.



If the records can be emailed, we will provide them to you
electronically at no cost. Should you have any questions, feel free to
contact me 914-243-8199.


Thank you,
Yvette Segal
District Clerk and Records Access Officer
Yorktown Central School District
2725 Crompond Road
Yorktown Heights, NY 10598
914-243-8199
Office Hours
8:00 am - 3:00 pm

title: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Given recent reports in the Buffalo News regarding instances of retroactively altered votes in the New York State Senate, I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Any and all written communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and text messages, among Senate members, their staff, and any other relevant parties, regarding the alteration of votes on the bill allowing Gov. Kathy Hochul to enter a new gaming compact with the Seneca Nation and the bill rolling back a major campaign finance reform law. This should cover the period from June 1, 2023, to the present.

2. Any and all instructions or guidelines provided to Senate members or their staff regarding the process or possibility of altering votes after they have been cast. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Any and all records of requests made by Senate members to alter their votes after they have been cast, including the reasons provided for such requests. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

I understand that there may be fees associated with the processing of this request. Please inform me of any such fees before processing the request.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform me of your agency's appeal procedures.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: Form submission from: Freedom of Information Request Form
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Parker:



            This is to acknowledge receipt of your request dated July 4, 2023 pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law.  You are requesting:



1.... Any and all written communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and text messages, among Senate members, their staff, and any other relevant parties, regarding the alteration of votes on the bill allowing Gov. Kathy Hochul to enter a new gaming compact with the Seneca Nation and the bill rolling back a major campaign finance reform law. This should cover the period from June 1, 2023, to the present.

            Response:  Please be advised the records you request, if the records even exist, are not subject to disclosure pursuant to Senate Rules.



            2. Any and all instructions or guidelines provided to Senate members or their staff regarding the process or possibility of altering votes after they have been cast. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

            Response: Please be advised after a search, there are no documents / records responsive to your request (or match your request).



            3. Any and all records of requests made by Senate members to alter their votes after they have been cast, including the reasons provided for such requests. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.…

            Response: Please be advised after a search, there are no documents / records responsive to your request (or match your request).



            I have attached a copy of the Senate’s Rules and Regulations Relating to the Public Inspection and Copying of Legislative Records for your information.







                                                                                                                        Sincerely,

                                                                                                                        Alejandra N. Paulino, Esq.

                                                                                                                        Secretary of the Senate

title: ALPR DETECTIONS/HITS/SHARING (Alapaha Police Department)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: ALPR DETECTIONS/HITS/SHARING (Alapaha Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) data;
2) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
3) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
4) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information;
5) The aggregate number of “detections” (i.e. license plate scans and associated data) collected during 2016; 
6) The aggregate number of detections collected during 2017;
7) The aggregate number of detections collected during 2018;
8) The aggregate number of “hits” (i.e. times that a plate on a hotlist was detected) during 2016; 
9) The aggregate number of “hits” during 2017;
10) The aggregate number of “hits” during 2018.

For Items 1-4: This information is easily available within the Agency’s Vigilant Solutions LEARN system. The simplest way to extract this data is to generate an “Agency Data Sharing Report” PDF file from within LEARN. To do this, a user may simply go to the “Sharing” section of LEARN and select “Output Report.” A CSV/XLS file containing these records would also satisfy this request.

The instructions for extracting this data is described on pages 62-63 of the LEARN Agency Manager Guide, which may be found at this link:

https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3860685-LEARN-5-1-Agency-Manager-Guide.html

An example of this record may be found at this link:

https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3936113-Palos-Verdes-Estates-Police-Department-Data.html

A number of other agencies have regularly determined the above information constitutes a public record and have provided an “Agency Data Sharing Report.” These agencies include:

Anaheim Police Department, Antioch Police Department, Bakersfield Police Department Chino Police Department, Clovis Police Department, Elk Grove Police Department, Fontana Police Department, Fountain Valley Police Department, Glendora Police Department, Hawthorne Police Department, Irvine Police Department, Livermore Police Department, Lodi Police Department, Long Beach Police Department, Montebello Police Department, Orange Police Department, Palos Verdes Estates Police Department, Red Bluff Police Department, Sacramento Police Department, San Bernardino Police Department, San Diego Police Department, San Rafael Police Department, San Ramon Police Department, Simi Valley Police Department, and the Tulare Police Department.

For Items 5-10: This information is easily available within the Agency’s Vigilant Solutions  LEARN system. The simplest way to extract this data is to generate a “Dashboard Hit Ratio Report” PDF file from within LEARN. We would prefer the data for each year to be provided separately.

An example of this document may be found at: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3870802-Sacramento-PD-Hit-Ratio-Rpt-010112-051917-Redacted.html

The instructions for extracting this data is described on pages 78-79 of the LEARN Agency Manager Guide, which may be found at this link: 
https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3860685-LEARN-5-1-Agency-Manager-Guide.html

The following agencies have regularly determined the above information constitutes a public record and have provided an “Dashboard Hit Ratio Report.” These agencies include:

Anaheim Police Department; Bakersfield Police Department; Chino Police Department; Clovis Police Department; Elk Grove Police Department; Fontana Police Department; Irvine Police Department; La Habra Police Department; Laguna Beach Police Department; Lodi Police Department; Sacramento Police Department; San Diego Police Department; San Ramon Police Department; and the Red Bluff Police Department.

For a  list of other agencies that have provided records of these nature, please visit: https://www.eff.org/pages/explore-alpr

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass

title: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log (Presque Isle Police Department)

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log (Presque Isle Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records Retention Schedules
Employee Name / Title / Salary List
Organizational Chart
Master List of Forms
FOAA Request Log (If kept)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Corey Bouchard

I am writing to respond to your request for Records Retention Schedules ,Employee Name / Title / Salary List, Organizational Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Request Log (If kept).
We follow the state of Maine record retention which are attached.
The budget can be accessed through the city's website here: 2023 Budget Book Final.pdf (dropbox.com)<https://www.dropbox.com/s/62myhmuot30ek3n/2023%20Budget%20Book%20Final.pdf?dl=0> and has the salary information for the some positions within the PD. title: Monument Remvoal

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Monument Remvoal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records pertaining sale of Health Sciences Park (formerly known as Forrest Park) to Memphis Greenspace in 2017. This includes, but is not limited to, all associated correspondence and documentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Katie King.

City of Memphis

title: Vivek Ramaswamy's Probably Stupid FOIA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Vivek Ramaswamy's Probably Stupid FOIA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On June 13, GOP Presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy claimed in a press conference that he has filed a Freedom of Information Act request  to uncover communications between the White House, Attorney General Merrick Garland, and special council Jack Smith relating to the indictment of former president Donald Trump. I'd like a copy of his request, as well as any internal communications regarding the processing of his request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Migrants deaths and remains found (Sheriff's Office (Reports))

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Migrants deaths and remains found (Sheriff's Office (Reports))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Specifically, I am seeking access to the following information regarding migrant remains that have been documented in your Medical Examiner Officer or County Sheriff's files for fiscal years 2017 - 2022:

Age
Sex
Body condition
Coordinates where the body was located
Country of origin
Cause of death

I understand that these records may contain sensitive information, and I assure you that any information provided will be used solely for legitimate research purposes.

Please inform me of any fees associated with this request, and I would be happy to provide payment if necessary. Additionally, please let me know if there are any limitations on the amount of information that can be provided, or if you require any further information from me in order to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas

title: Incident report for 2017 Aztec High School shooting

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Incident report for 2017 Aztec High School shooting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Aztec High School in Aztec on 12/07/2017.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julian Wray
